column1: Variable Type,Variable,Information,Variable Schema,Dashboard,Notes,Data Link,Reference,Internal Model Variable,Default LHS Scalar Minimum at Final Time Period,Default LHS Scalar Maximum at Final Time Period,``$CAT-MANURE-MANAGEMENT$``,Fraction Manure Management,Emissions Total by Gas Component

Input,:math:`\text{CH}_4` Enteric Fermentation Emission Factor,"This represents emissions from enteric fermentation, primarily occuring in multigastric ruminant livestock (including buffalo, camels, cattle, goats, and sheep)","``ef_lvst_entferm_$CAT-LIVESTOCK$_$UNIT-MASS$_$EMISSION-GAS$_$UNIT-POPULATION$`` (``$EMISSION-GAS$ = ch4``, ``$UNIT-POPULATION$ = head``, ``$UNIT-MASS$ = kg``)",`Enteric Fermentation (CH4) Dashboard <https://public.tableau.com/shared/PZP8XTG4Z?:display_count=n&:origin=viz_share_link>`_,"
column2: Default values taken from V4 C10, Table 10.10 (non cattle/buffalo livestock) and 10.11 (cattle and buffalo) of IPCC GNGHGI 2019R using a default mean between low and high productivity systems.

Uncertainty ranges set by using mean in conjunction with low productivity and high end ranges. Default ranges for no information were constrained relative to similar animal types.",`Enteric Fermentation (CH4) data on Google Drive <https://drive.google.com/file/d/11zpYhIFunglJs5Dr5qNE0gz-ZUYilmTF/view?usp=sharing>`_,

column1: Input,Animal Weight,Average weight of a single animal,``avgmass_lvst_animal_$CAT-LIVESTOCK$_$UNIT-MASS$`` (``$UNIT-MASS$ = kg``),,,,,0,1,1,none,0,0

Input,Daily Dry Matter Consumption,"Used to allocate grassland to grazing animals and estimate carrying capacity under the assumption that the distribution of livestock across grazelands is uniform, grasslands are homogenous, and that there is no mixed grazing (though this could be implemented as a policy parameter). Model parameter that should be constant (only first year is used). Livestock that are non-grazing (e.g. pigs and chickens) should have a value of 0 for this variable. ",``qty_lvst_daily_dry_matter_consumed_$CAT-LIVESTOCK$_$UNIT-MASS$`` (``$UNIT-MASS$ = kg``),,,,"Numbers in pounds from Table 5, `Holechek 1988 <https://journals.uair.arizona.edu/index.php/rangelands/article/download/10362/9633>`_. Estimated conversion of 2.2 lbs/kg used to estimate kg.",0,1,1,none,0,0

column2: Unitless weight factor that represents how much nitrogen is generated per weight of animal. Used to estimate :math:`Nex_{(T)}` in Equation 10.34 (V4C10 IPCC GNGHGI 2019R).
See Table 10.19 for default factors.",,,0,1,1,none,0,0

column1: Input,Daily Volatile Solid Generation Factor,"Daily generation rate, per animal weight, of equivalent volatile solids (manure). See V4, C10, Equation 22A (IPCC GNGHGI 2019R).",``genfactor_lvst_daily_volatile_solids_$CAT-LIVESTOCK$``,,,,
column2: See Table 10.13A in IPCC V4C10 Table 10.13A (mean values) for defaults,0,1,1,none,0,0

column1: Input,Initial Livestock Head Count,Initial population of animal; note that only the first value (associated with t = 0) will be used.
